JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Khanlar Hajiyev
TEXT: The applicant , Mr PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . He is a former military prosecutor and head of the legal firm “ GPE and Partners ” . The respondent Government are represented by PERSON , former Representative of ORG at ORG .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE ORG of ORG instituted criminal proceedings against the applicant and CARDINAL other persons on suspicion of several counts of aggravated bribery . The applicant appears to have been immediately notified of the charges against him . In DATE the investigation was completed and the applicant was served with the bill of indictment and committed to stand trial before ORG of FAC .
On DATE ORG of FAC found the applicant guilty of bribery and sentenced him to DATE imprisonment . The judgment was not appealed against and became final .
The applicant was released on probation by a decision of ORG of GPE on DATE .
On DATE the Military Section of ORG of GPE quashed the judgment of DATE by way of supervisory - review proceedings and remitted the case for fresh examination to ORG of FAC .
On DATE ORG of ORG received the case file . The first hearing was scheduled for DATE .

Of the CARDINAL hearings fixed DATE and DATE , CARDINAL were adjourned because witnesses failed to appear and CARDINAL hearings were postponed because a new prosecutor had been assigned to the case and he needed time to study the case file .

On DATE ORG of FAC held that since LAW had entered into force on DATE it no longer had competence to examine the applicant ’s case and it sent the case to ORG of ORG . On DATE that decision was quashed on supervisory review by the ORG of ORG of ORG . The case was then sent back to ORG of FAC for trial .

On DATE the Military Section of ORG of GPE , by way of supervisory review , decided that the case was within the competence of ORG of ORG , quashed the decision of DATE and restored the decision of DATE .

On DATE ORG of ORG scheduled a preliminary hearing for DATE . In the meantime , the applicant had asked the trial court to stay the proceedings , citing his poor state of health and lack of resources to travel to GPE where trial hearings were to take place . ORG re - scheduled the hearing for DATE .

On DATE the applicant again informed ORG that he was unable to attend and made another request for a stay . DATE ORG examined his request and decided to proceed with the examination of the case . The hearing was fixed for DATE .
DATE and DATE ORG held CARDINAL hearings . The applicant failed to appear once .
On DATE ORG of ORG acquitted the applicant .
On DATE ORG of GPE quashed that judgment and remitted the case for re - examination .

On DATE ORG scheduled a hearing for DATE and sent a telegram to the applicant , who resided in GPE , informing him of the date and time of the hearing . In addition , summonses to the hearing were sent by registered mail . The telegram reached the applicant ’s home on DATE . The summonses were served on him on DATE . DATE ORG received a telegram from the applicant ’s father notifying the trial court that the applicant had been admitted to hospital for treatment and that he was therefore unable to get to PERSON to take part in the trial . Medical documents confirming the applicant ’s father ’s statement were sent to ORG by mail .

On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings until DATE because the applicant had not appeared for the hearing and his presence was mandatory . DATE a telegram was sent to the applicant informing him that a hearing was scheduled for DATE . He was also notified that his presence was required and that he would be forcibly escorted to the court if he failed to attend .

On DATE ORG received a telegram from the applicant ’s father informing it that the applicant was undergoing treatment in a hospital in GPE and that he could not get to GPE to participate in the trial . DATE ORG received medical documents confirming that information .

The next hearing was scheduled for CARDINAL DATE and the applicant was duly summoned to it . ORG also sent telegrams to ORG of ORG and the head of ORG enquiring about the applicant ’s state of health and his ability to participate in the trial .
The applicant did not attend the hearing on DATE , citing his admission to hospital , and a hearing was scheduled for DATE .

On DATE ORG received a telegram from the applicant notifying it that he had been discharged from hospital on DATE . At the same time the applicant stressed that he required out - patient treatment for DATE and would therefore be unable to get to PERSON until DATE . DATE the court received copies of medical documents corroborating the applicant ’s assertion . The applicant also submitted copies of letters from ORG showing that his application form and subsequent letters had been received by the ORG .

On DATE ORG held a hearing . When the applicant did not appear for the hearing the trial court rescheduled the hearing for DATE . On DATE ORG received a copy of the applicant ’s medical history . The applicant did not attend the hearing on DATE and the proceedings were stayed until DATE .

On DATE the applicant informed ORG that a military medical commission had examined him and had found that he needed to continue medical treatment for DATE . The applicant sent a copy of the commission ’s report to the trial court by mail .

In response to the information received from the applicant , ORG stayed the proceedings until DATE and sent a letter to ORG of ORG and ORG asking them to confirm the applicant ’s assertion that he was unfit to take part in the proceedings . On DATE ORG replied that the applicant required hospital treatment for DATE .

ORG rescheduled the hearing for DATE and once again requested information on the applicant ’s health . In addition , it asked the head of ORG and the head of ORG of GPE to provide assistance in securing the applicant ’s presence at the trial hearings .
On DATE ORG received a letter from the head of ORG of GPE . The letter read as follows :
“ In response to your [ letter ] about [ the applicant ’s ] failure to attend the hearing in GPE , [ I ] inform you that :

[ The applicant ] was treated in [ hospital ] from DATE , from CARDINAL DATE and from DATE to DATE . The admissions to hospital were well - founded ; the copies of the medical documents issued by [ the hospital ] and presented to you are authentic .

Subsequently [ the applicant ] continued to be monitored by [ the hospital ] . This monitoring was done without his being granted sick leave , as the hospital did not record any acute attacks of his chronic diseases during the monitoring period . The copies of documents issued by [ the hospital ] and submitted by you are authentic ; however , they do not indicate that [ the applicant ] was incapacitated only temporarily . [ The applicant ’s ] state of health and his out - patient treatment did not prevent his presence at the hearings in GPE . [ The applicant ] is not currently being monitored by [ the hospital ] . ”

On DATE ORG held a hearing which the applicant attended . DATE and DATE ORG scheduled CARDINAL hearings , of which CARDINAL were adjourned because the applicant failed to appear and CARDINAL was postponed at the request of a co - defendant who had to attend the funeral of a close relative .

Of the CARDINAL hearings fixed between DATE and DATE , CARDINAL hearings were postponed because the applicant did not attend , CARDINAL were adjourned because a co - defendant did not attend , and CARDINAL was rescheduled so that one of the witnesses could attend .

On DATE ORG of ORG discontinued the criminal proceedings against the applicant and relieved him of criminal liability as the statutory limitation period had expired . The judgment was not appealed against and became final .
